page.title: 13Manor Mercury
page.content: {Manor Mercury}is a newspaper for the Manor Area produced with the help of the Manor Employment Project and students of Journalism at the local College of Further Education. It was first published about 2 years ago, and has appeared monthly since then. The cost has varied from 5p to 10p and is now distributed free. At meetings to set up the paper in 1983 and 1984, they had to make decisions about how many to print, who would have Editorial control, and where the money would come from to start them off. Articles have appeared on, amongst other things: Welfare Rights, Problems with council housing, Support for miners during the recent strike, Women's rights, Vandalism, Local History, Local Schools.
